Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of May 22, 2013 be adopted as printed by Council Member Richards.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Richards moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of May 22, 2013 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title: Messages & Papers from the Mayor
Communications from City, County & Borough Offices

Communication from the Council Member Jumanne D. Williams – Submitting to the Council formal notice of intent, pursuant to Rule 7.130 of the Council,  to move to discharge the Committee on Public Safety from further consideration of  Introductory Number 1079  - in relation to the investigating, reviewing, studying, and auditing of and making of recommendations relating to the operations, policies, programs and practices of the New York City police department by the commissioner of the department of investigation.
Items.ActionName: Rcvd, Ord, Prnt, Fld by Council
Items.ActionText: This Communication was Rcvd, Ord, Prnt, Fld by Council
Items.MatterName: Discharge Motion - Int. No. 1079 - Investigating, reviewing, studying, and auditing of and making of recommendations relating to the operations, policies, programs and practices of the NYPD by the commissioner of the department of investigation.

Items.Title: Communication from the Council Member Jumanne D. Williams – Submitting to the Council formal notice of intent, pursuant to Rule 7.130 of the Council,    to move to discharge the Committee on Public Safety from further consideration of  Introductory Number 1080 - in relation to prohibiting bias-based profiling.
Items.ActionName: Rcvd, Ord, Prnt, Fld by Council
Items.ActionText: This Communication was Rcvd, Ord, Prnt, Fld by Council
Items.MatterName: Discharge Motion - Int. No. 1080 - Prohibiting bias-based profiling.

Report of the Committee on Consumer Affairs
A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the price of items sold at newsstands.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: The price of items sold at newsstands.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon Congress to pass and the President to sign S.897/H.R.1979, the Bank on Students Loan Fairness Act, which would reduce the interest rate of federal subsidized Stafford student loans for one year from the current 3.4% to 0.75%.
Items.AgendaNote: Preconsidered - Adopted by the Committee on Higher Education
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) declared the Resolution to be adopted.
Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Bank on Students Loan Fairness Act (S.897/H.R.1979)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon Congress to pass and the President to sign S.1066, the Federal Student Loan Refinancing Act by Senator Gillibrand, which would help reduce student debt.
Items.AgendaNote: Preconsidered - Adopted by the Committee on Higher Education
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) declared the Resolution to be adopted.
Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Federal Student Loan Refinancing Act (S.1066)

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS

Resolution authorizing the Speaker to intervene, file an amicus brief, or join an amicus brief on behalf of the Council of the City of New York in the litigation captioned Pelegrin v. New York City Human Resources Administration, for the purpose of defending provisions of the New York City Charter that require city agencies to provide public notice and the opportunity for public comment on proposed new rules and rule changes before adoption.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MatterName: Authorizing the Speaker to intervene, file an amicus brief, or join an amicus brief on behalf of the Council of the City of NY in the litigation captioned Pelegrin v. NYC Human Resources Administration.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to emergency preparedness recommendations for owners of residential and commercial buildings and the posting of emergency information in certain residential buildings.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Emergency preparedness recommendations for owners of residential and commercial buildings and the posting of emergency information in certain residential buildings.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city plumbing code, in relation to requiring that toilets and faucets be capable of operating without an external supply of electrical power.

Items.MatterName: Requiring that toilets and faucets be capable of operating without an external supply of electrical power.

Items.MatterName: Secondary electrical power, heating and cooling systems for I-1 and I-2 occupancies and for adult homes, enriched housing, community residences and intermediate care facilities, where such occupancies are located in flood-prone areas.

Items.Title: Resolution to establish that the interest rate to be charged for Fiscal Year 2014 for non-payment of water rents and sewer rents be 18% per annum for real property where the assessed value is over $250,000, or over $250,000 per residential unit for cooperative apartments.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Establish that the interest rate to be charged for FY'14 for non-payment of water rents and sewer rents be 18% per annum for real property where the assessed value is over $250,000, or over $250,000 per residential unit for cooperative apartments.

Items.Title: Resolution to establish that the interest rate to be charged for Fiscal Year 2014 for non-payment of water rents and sewer rents be 9% per annum for real property where the assessed value is not more than $250,000, or not more than $250,000 per residential unit for cooperative apartments.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Establish that the interest rate to be charged for FY'14 for non-payment of water rents and sewer rents be 9% per annum for real property where the assessed value is not more than $250,000, or not more than $250,000 per residential unit for cooperative ap

Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Establish that the interest rate be 18% per annum for FY'14 for non-payment of taxes on properties with an assessed value of over $250,000, or over $250,000 per residential unit for cooperative apartments.

Items.Title: Resolution to establish that the interest rate be 9% per annum for Fiscal Year 2014 for non-payment of taxes on properties with an assessed value of not more than $250,000, or not more than $250,000 per residential unit for cooperative apartments.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Establish that the interest rate be 9% per annum for FY'14 for non-payment of taxes on properties with an assessed value of not more than $250,000, or not more than $250,000 per residential unit for cooperative apartments.

Items.Title: Resolution to establish that the discount percentage for early payment of real estate taxes be set at 1.0% per annum for Fiscal Year 2014.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Establish that the discount percentage for early payment of real estate taxes be set at 1.0% per annum for FY'14.

Items.MinutesNote: At this point the Speaker (Council Member Quinn) made the following annoucements:

Whereupon on motion of the Speaker (Council Member Quinn), the President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) adjourned to meet again on Wednesday, June 26, 2013.



MICHAEL McSWEENEY, City Clerk

Clerk of the Council
The President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera)  put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such reports, which were decided in the affirmative by the following vote:
